ChoiceDataElement.Label: Benign Features
ChoiceDataElement.Hint: Benign imaging features include homogeneous, low density and smooth margins

Choice.Label: Density less than equalto 10 HU on unenhanced CT

ChoiceDataElement.Label: History of malignancy
ChoiceDataElement.Hint: Whether the patient has a history of malignancy, raising index of suspicion for metastatic disease

IntegerDataElement.Hint: Image series the finding is best seen on
IntegerDataElement.Label: Series

IntegerDataElement.Hint: The image number within the series the finding is best seen on

is new or has enlarged in this patient with no history of malignancy.

is new or has enlarged and is suspicious for neoplasm. Recommend biochemical assays to determine functional status and exclude pheochromocytoma. Also, depending on the clinical scenario, consider resection vs. follow-up in 6-12 months with adrenal protocol CT, although chemical-shift MRI may be considered.
is new or has enlarged and is suspicious for neoplasm.

Recommend biochemical assays to determine functional status and exclude pheochromocytoma. Also, depending on the clinical scenario, consider resection vs. follow-up in 6-12 months with adrenal protocol CT, although chemical-shift MRI may be considered.
is new or has enlarged in this patient with a history of malignancy.
is new or has enlarged and is suspicious for neoplasm. Recommend biochemical assays to determine functional status and exclude pheochromocytoma. Also, consider biopsy or PET-CT.

is new or has enlarged in this patient whose history of malignancy is unknown.

is new or has enlarged and is suspicious for neoplasm, with increased risk if there is a history of malignancy. Recommend biochemical assays to determine functional status and exclude pheochromocytoma. Also, further evaluation depends on whether there is a history of malignancy. If there is no history of malignancy, depending on the clinical scenario, consider resection vs. follow-up in 6-12 months with adrenal protocol CT, although chemical-shift MRI may be considered. If there is a history of malignancy, consider biopsy or PET-CT.
is new or has enlarged and is suspicious for neoplasm, with increased risk if there is a history of malignancy.

Recommend biochemical assays to determine functional status and exclude pheochromocytoma. Also, further evaluation depends on whether there is a history of malignancy. If there is no history of malignancy, depending on the clinical scenario, consider resection vs. follow-up in 6-12 months with adrenal protocol CT, although chemical-shift MRI may be considered. If there is a history of malignancy, consider biopsy or PET-CT.
has been stable for less than one year and has indeterminate features in this patient with a history of malignancy.

cm is stable, but with less than one-year follow-up. Features are indeterminate for neoplasm. Consider biochemical assays to determine functional status and exclude pheochromocytoma, if not done recently. Recommend adrenal CT protocol or chemical-shift MRI, if not done after the initial examination. Depending on the interval since the initial examination, alternatively consider follow-up with adrenal CT protocol or chemical-shift MRI with a follow-up interval from the initial examination of at least 12 months, to confirm stability.

cm is stable, but with less than one-year follow-up. Features are indeterminate for neoplasm. Consider biochemical assays to determine functional status and exclude pheochromocytoma, if not done recently.

Recommend adrenal CT protocol or chemical-shift MRI, if not done after the initial examination. Depending on the interval since the initial examination, alternatively consider follow-up with adrenal CT protocol or chemical-shift MRI with a follow-up interval from the initial examination of at least 12 months, to confirm stability.
has been stable for less than one year and has indeterminate features.

cm has been stable, but with less than one-year follow-up, and remains indeterminate for neoplasm. Given the patient’s history of malignancy and metastatic disease, further diagnostic evaluation depends upon whether there is possible benefit.
cm has been stable, but with less than one-year follow-up, and remains indeterminate for neoplasm.

has been stable for less than one year and has indeterminate features in this patient with no history of malignancy.

Also consider follow-up with adrenal CT protocol or chemical-shift MRI with a follow-up interval from the initial examination of at least 12 months, to confirm stability.
